policies.attendance: Students are expected to attend class each week.
policies.late_work: Assignments received 1-6 days late will have 20% of the total points deducted. Assignments received more than one week late will receive 0 points.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Baseline technical skills necessary for online courses include basic computer and web-browsing skills, navigating Canvas, live web conferencing using Zoom, recording a slide presentation with audio narration, and recording, editing, and uploading video via Kaltura.
additional_info.support_resources: For more information about course access or support, contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

instructor.name: Frank Gallucci and Dr. Andres Jimenez, MD, MSED, MBA, MS

_metadata.course_description: In this course, students will evaluate and create their own perspectives on business strategies. They will develop an understanding of entrepreneurship and innovation in starting and growing a business venture.
learning_outcomes: Differentiate between small business ideas and entrepreneurial business ideas.
